violation.title: Your project gitignore file should not contain user-specific files
violation.message: .DS_Store is user-specific and should not appear in a project .gitignore. Consider adding it to the user global .gitignore instead.
violation.context:
# .nfs files are created when an open file is removed but is still being accessed .nfs*
### macOS ### # General .DS_Store .AppleDouble .LSOverride
# Icon must end with two \r Icon

violation.title: Your project gitignore file should not contain user-specific files
violation.message: Icon is user-specific and should not appear in a project .gitignore. Consider adding it to the user global .gitignore instead.
violation.context:
.DS_Store .AppleDouble .LSOverride
# Icon must end with two \r Icon
# Thumbnails ._*
# Files that might appear in the root of a volume

violation.title: Your project gitignore file should not contain user-specific files
violation.message: Thumbs.db is user-specific and should not appear in a project .gitignore. Consider adding it to the user global .gitignore instead.
violation.context:
# Build data /build/
### Windows ### # Windows thumbnail cache files Thumbs.db Thumbs.db:encryptable ehthumbs.db ehthumbs_vista.db
# Dump file

violation.title: Your project gitignore file should not contain user-specific files
violation.message: ehthumbs.db is user-specific and should not appear in a project .gitignore. Consider adding it to the user global .gitignore instead.
violation.context:
### Windows ### # Windows thumbnail cache files Thumbs.db Thumbs.db:encryptable ehthumbs.db ehthumbs_vista.db
# Dump file *.stackdump

violation.title: Text files should end with a valid new line character.
violation.message: This file ends with no newline character, or with a different newline character than other files in your project. It won't render properly on a terminal, and it's considered a bad practice.

violation.title: Your project should not contain commented code
violation.message: Commented out code reduces readability and lowers the code confidence for other developers. If it's common usage for debug, it should not be committed. Using a version control system, such code can be safely removed.
